Author: actionslacks#4072
Content: I think the hack and the way it was handled showed the strength of the project. everyone with the exception of jl was made whole. As for the NN drama, I would venture that the shit that goes on behind closed doors with other projects would make it look incredibly tame by comparison. It's no excuse, but the system is the first of it's kind and there are no best practices to follow. I'm amazed that this amalgamation of random people from across the planet can agree on anything at all, much less run an enterprise level, secure network that has resisted any and all attacks, even internal ones.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: each issue except the json? And though potential solutions may have been vocalised and discussed, just because NN consensus chose an alternative (after long and arduous conversation), does not excuse going nuclear. CG repeats his points ad nauseum, but manages to maintain a level of grudging acceptance and mirth when it goes another way. Your "offer" to sell nodes was repeated and there was no interest until it your consistent disgruntled disruption wore people down enough to capitulate so we could get on with work. You took your profits and then assumed a half month of ownership was due a full month of the mining, and in not getting your way I assume you resumed your disgruntled disruption.  Maybe I'm not privy to everything, but this is what I saw. As it was happening I expressed that your insights had merit, though I completely disagree with how you have acted, regardless of any emotional distress you have been experiencing from outside KMD. Though extreme emotional stress may explain actions, it does not excuse them. I told you to take a break and get some air, shit I even tipped you to get a massage while on holiday. Sometimes a step back can reveal a more effective route forward. In my experience, rash acts while under emotional duress tend to moke this worse, not better.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: I'm all for the insights of contrarian opinion and learning from fails. Not so much a fan of dramatics and personal attacks

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: Things changed. Maybe you are not aware after you left the conversation. I work daily to improve KMD and test its tech, and I'm not the only one. I have my opinions, but tend to keep them to myself while listening to others, until I have better understanding of where I might be wrong, and refrain from striking out when my opinion is not the one that is chosen. Governance is interactive, and reducing it to the those that shout loudest is not ideal. I'm not spending all day going in circles discussing this, I'd rather dive back into code and prodcutively improve the things I am able to.
